abstract.text: A collection of segments that connect to graph a complex curve over a linear input.

inlineContent.text: defines a complex graph that determines the volume of audio data over an input duration. PHASE uses envelopes in a similar way. Given a value on the envelope’s input axis, the
function plots and returns the result on the output axis. The following are possible uses of this class:
, can shape their volume using an envelope; see
Distance models shape sounds with a 3D position using an envelope; see
An envelope can do more than shape audio. To gradually change an envelope’s input value over time, use the
class, which creates a function with a metaparameter value as input. An app can use the numeric result for any purpose. For example, the x-axis can be distance and the y-axis can be playback rate.
At runtime, PHASE determines whether a particular member of the
array slopes up or down along the domain depending on the envelope’s particular use case.

content.text: Create an Envelope and Shape its Curve

inlineContent.text: To use an envelope in your app, define its shape by defining a series of segments. Each segment specifies a curve that collectively connect to form a graph. The following code creates an envelope with a single segment that’s shaped like the lettter

code: // Create a single segment with a sigmoid curve to give "ease in,
//  ease out" movement along the domain. Define an endpoint of (1, 1).
// Add the segment to the array.
// Create the envelope and set the start point to (-1, -1).
// Create a single segment with a sigmoid curve to give "ease in,
//  ease out" movement along the domain. Define an endpoint of (1, 1).
// Add the segment to the array.
// Create the envelope and set the start point to (-1, -1).

inlineContent.text: The graph flexes at runtime depending on the source content on which the envelope operates. A
function’s output to predertermined values. Instead, PHASE applies the envelope’s curves to the source content as a rate of change.

abstract.text: Create dynamic audio experiences in your game or app that react to events and cues in the environment.
A node that smoothly fades between the audio of its child nodes.
Adds a child node with an envelope.
Options that apply a mathematical function to an input value.
A collection of segments that connect to graph a complex curve over a linear input.
The range of the envelope’s possible input values.
Provides the height of the envelope for an input value.
Creates an envelope with a start point and segments.
The bounds of the output value.
An array of the envelope’s segments.
The starting point along the envelope’s duration.
A graph of points and curves that shapes the volume of a sound over distance.
A curved portion of an envelope.
A metaparameter that graphs an input value on a set of mathematical curves.
An ordered pair that defines a bounding box for an envelope.
Change the characteristics of in-flight audio by adjusting its properties at runtime.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
